tool_description: All active national football players, positions, teams, and numbers. Great for frontend player searches.
title: National Football Players

api_list.name: Player
api_list.description: Returns player info of player specified (i.e. name, number, position, team). Use hyphenated name with capitals (i.e. Tom-Brady)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://national-football-players.p.rapidapi.com/player/{playername}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "national-football-players.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Team Roster
api_list.description: Returns roster of football team. Use team abbreviation when specifying team (i.e. BUF, NE, MIA, etc.). See /teams to get team names and abbreviations
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://national-football-players.p.rapidapi.com/roster/{team}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "national-football-players.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: All Teams
api_list.description: Returns an array of all football teams and abbreviations
api_list.code:

api_list.name: Players at Position
api_list.description: Returns all of the players at specified position. Only use abbreviated position names for position (i.e. QB, RB, WR, etc). See list of current positions @ /position
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://national-football-players.p.rapidapi.com/position/{position}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "national-football-players.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())
